content.question: Which of the following pieces of historical evidence would best modify the overall argument of the excerpt?

choices.label: Political machines engaged in active campaigns to naturalize new Irish immigrants as citizens.
Some urban areas with large Irish populations did not develop Irish-dominated political machines.
Irish people received a significant percent of new patronage jobs created in New York City in the 1890s.
The Irish in San Francisco were more likely to vote than other ethnic groups in the late 1890s and early 1900s.

content.answer: Some urban areas with large Irish populations did not develop Irish-dominated political machines.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain how claims or evidence support, modify, or refute a source's argument.
